Key Arguments: The legislation grants ACMA excessive control over online information dissemination.
Freedom of speech and expression are threatened by government censorship.
Censorship of dissenting opinions is a step towards totalitarianism.
Misinformation and disinformation are subjective and can change as knowledge advances.
The legislation disregards human rights related to freedom of speech and privacy.
Notable Quotes: Censorship of dissenting opinions is the first step in totalitarianism and I strongly oppose it.
Misinformation and disinformation are a matter of opinion and belief.
This is the sort of legislation that one would expect in a repressive, communist country.
